verses.text: 幾隻死蒼蠅能使做香料者的膏油發霉變臭，一點點愚昧比智慧和榮譽的影響更大。

words.note: Contextually related to perfumery/ointment
Often refers to sacred anointing oil
Often used in contrast to wisdom in scripture

verses.text: 智慧人的心向右，愚昧人的心偏左。
verses.heading: Wisdom Can Be Nullified By the Caprice of Rulers

verses.text: 愚昧人連走路的時候，也顯出無知；他對每一個人表現出他是個愚昧人（「他對每一個人表現出他是個愚昧人」或譯：「他稱每一個人都是愚昧的」）。

words.note: Translator's note indicating an alternative rendering

verses.text: 如果掌權者向你發怒，你不要離開原位，因為柔順能免大過。

words.note: Implies a humble and yielding attitude
Implies a serious mistake or transgression

verses.text: 在日光之下我看見一件憾事，好像是出於官長無意的錯誤，

words.note: Common phrase in Ecclesiastes meaning 'in the world'
A matter causing regret or sorrow

verses.text: 就是愚昧人得居眾多高位，富有的人卻處卑位。

words.note: Refers to someone lacking wisdom or understanding.
Often used in contrast with 高位 (high position).

verses.text: 我見過奴僕騎馬，貴族卻像奴僕一樣在地上步行。

words.note: A common term for servants/slaves in ancient texts.
A common term for servants/slaves in ancient texts.

verses.text: 挖陷阱的，自己掉進去；拆牆垣的，有蛇來咬他。

words.note: Refers to a defensive wall or enclosure.

verses.heading: Wisdom is Needed to Avert Dangers in Everyday Life

verses.text: 採石的，被石打傷；劈柴的，被柴損害。
斧頭若鈍了，還不把斧刃磨快，就必多費力氣；智慧的好處在於助人成功。

words.note: Often refers to divine or profound wisdom, especially in Ecclesiastes/Proverbs.

verses.text: 未行法術先被蛇咬，那麼，法術對行法術的人就毫無用處。

words.note: Refers to magical arts or divination.
Emphasizes a complete lack of something.

verses.text: 智慧人的口，說出恩言；愚昧人的嘴，卻吞滅自己。

words.note: Refers to words that bring blessing or grace.
Stronger than just 'swallow', implies destruction.

verses.heading: Words and Works of Wise Men and Fools

verses.text: 愚昧人的話開頭是愚昧，結尾是邪惡狂妄。
愚昧人多言多語。人不知道將來會有甚麼事，誰能告訴他死後會發生甚麼事呢？

words.note: An idiom describing someone who talks too much.

verses.text: 愚昧人的勞碌徒使自己困乏，他連怎樣進城也不知道。

words.note: Often used to imply futility or pointlessness.

verses.text: 邦國啊，如果你的王是個孩童，而你的大臣又一早吃喝宴樂，你就有禍了。

words.note: Combination of 'eat/drink' and 'feast/enjoy'.

verses.heading: The Problem with Foolish Rulers

verses.text: 邦國啊，如果你的王是貴冑之子，而你的大臣又按時吃喝，為要得力，不為醉酒，你就有福了。

words.note: Classical term for nobility or their descendants.
Classical equivalent of modern '的'.
Functions as a single prepositional phrase.

words.definition: not for, not for the purpose of

verses.text: 房頂塌下是因為懶惰，房屋滴漏是因為懶得動手。

words.definition: too lazy to, not bothered to
words.note: Indicates reluctance due to laziness.

words.definition: start to work, lift a hand

verses.text: 設宴是為歡笑，酒能使人生快活，金錢能解決萬事。

words.definition: hold a banquet, arrange a feast

verses.text: 不要在意念中咒罵君王，也不要在臥房中咒罵財主，因為空中的飛鳥會傳聲，有翅膀的會述說這事。

words.note: Used as a noun suffix to indicate 'within'.
Used as a noun suffix to indicate 'within'.
Frequently appears in parables/teachings about wealth in the Bible.
Nominalizes the preceding phrase '有翅膀' (those with wings).
